alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 5:54PM MST until July 05 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 900 PM MST. * At 553 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain along and near Highway 89 at Bitter Springs and Tanner Wash. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bitter Springs, Tanner Wash and Jackass Creek. This includes the following slot canyons... Tanner Wash and Jackass Canyon. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 521 and 533. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 524 and 533. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Jackass Creek, Tanner Wash, and the Colorado River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Beware of rockfalls near steep terrain. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
